thread.title: Thursday's High Schools: McCann girls soccer qualifies for Western Mass. tourney
thread.title_full: Thursday's High Schools: McCann girls soccer qualifies for Western Mass. tourney

author:
Berkshire Eagle Staff
sports@berkshireeagle.com @EagleSportsZone on Twitter
title: Thursday's High Schools: McCann girls soccer qualifies for Western Mass. tourney
text:
— 6 McCann goals—Mike Wojtaszek 2, Cody Jordan 2, Brenden Piaggi, Justin Brassard. McCann assists—Brassard 2, Wojtaszek, James Dix. Pathfinder goal—Teddy King. Pathfinder assist—Aron Gilman. Saves—MT: Evan Canales 7, Nico Moreno 2. P: Ramon Dole 12. Golf 
PITTSFIELD 152, TACONIC 170 
In Pittsfield, the Pittsfield golf team continues it strong play, beating rival Taconic at the par-35 Pittsfield Country Club. 
Jake Driscoll took medalist honors with a 38. Mike Kays led Taconic with a 41. 
The Generals improved to 12-2. 
"It's always a big match for the kids," Pittsfield coach Chris Polidoro said on facing Taconic. "My kids are playing great, and I'm really looking forward to Western Mass." 
——— TACONIC (170): Kevin Rochelo 44, Ross Omelenchuck 43, Mike Kays 41, Tim Curry 53, Brett Murphy 42, Connor Champoux 50. PITTSFIELD (152): Kevin Quinto 42, Connor McDonugh 41, Ricky Berrian 48, Justin Martin 43, Jake Driscoll 38, Thomas Symanski 41. Birdies — T: Kays (No. 4). P: McDonough (No. 6), Quinto (No. 8), Murphy (No. 5). 
LENOX 179, ST. JOE 186 
At Cranwell, the Millionaires kept the Crusaders at arms length to get the win. Lenox was led by medalist Lucy Schwartz who shot a 42 and Noah Hunter carding a 44 that included a birdie on the second hole of the par-35, front nine. 
"We're getting more consistent with our scoring — not great scores — but holding steady," said Lenox coach Dick Salinetti. "We're still playing hard for a tournament berth." 
If the Millionaires at 5-6, win two of their last three matches, they will qualify for the Western Mass. tournament. 
St. Joe was led by Cody Tynan's 43. 
——— LENOX (179): Lucy Schwartz, Noah Hunter 44, Kevin Coakley 45, Ricky Armstrong 48, Matthew Shields 51, Zach Zurrin 58 ST. JOSEPH (186): Cody Tynan 43, Andy Cella 46, Jacob Felix 48, Mike Gingras 49, Brent Arseneau 55, Conor Thurston 59 Birdies: Hunter (No. 2), Cella (No. 2), Felix (No. 3) 
LEE 161, MOUNT EVERETT 206 
In Great Barrington, Lee defeated Mount Everett, sending the Eagles to a winless season. 
Devyn Olds earned medalist honors at the par 34 Egremont Country Club, shooting a 38. 
Christian Wells led Everett (0-14) with a 48. 
"We saw improvement," Everett coach Fred Finkle said on his team's season. "But it was one of those season where we couldn't gel as a team." 
——— LEE (161): Devyn Olds 38, Thomas Fraser 39, Bryce Whalen 43, Colin Finnegan 41, Hunter Roosa 46, David Belanger 45. MOUNT EVERETT (206): Christian Wells 48, Jake Christinat 50, Sean Smith 56, Anthony Consolini 58, Patrick Hogelin 52, Colby Stevens 59. Birdies — L: Olds (No. 4), Fraser (No. 1), Roosa (No. 2). 
MCCANN TECH 12, FRANKLIN TECH 12 
In Adams, the Hornets battled visiting Franklin Tech (6-6-1)s to a draw at Forest Park Golf Club. 
Brad Tatro had a big day for the Hornets (4-5-1), earning medalist honors with a 43 and beating Franklin Tech's Jacob Sisson by two strokes and 3-1. 
The visitors managed the tie when Dante Rosado had 3 1/2 out of a possible four points in his match at No. 6 against Joe Serrano. 
"With this tie we now have a win our last match to get into Western Mass. Our goal is right in front of us," McCann coach Corbin Brassard wrote in an email. 
——— McCANN TECH (12): Brad Tatro 43 (3), Ryan Meehan 49 (2 1/2), Cole Kratz 49 (1 1/2), Jake Tower 51 (2), Brian Boudreau 53 (2 1/2), Joe Serrano 53 (1/2). FRANKLIN TECH (12): Jacob Sisson 45 91), Travis Cutting 54 (1 1/2), Tyler Raymond 48 (2 1/2), Hunter Sessions 48 (2), Mike Patnode 56 (1 1/2), Dante Rosado 48 (3 1/2).
